title: Jan. 6 rioters go free after Trump pardons
shortDescription: Just hours after being sworn into his second term as president, Donald Trump delivered on his campaign promise of pardoning Jan. 6 rioters. More than 1,500 people who were charged or convicted of crimes relating to the Capitol riot in 2021.

title: Backlash to Trump's Jan. 6 pardons halted following Biden's pardons
shortDescription: Biden Monday issued several preemptive pardons, some to family members. Following the transition of power, Trump wielded his own clemency power.

title: Trump birthright citizenship order won't affect VP's wife | Fact check
shortDescription: Trump's executive order is not retroactive and would apply only to those born more than 30 days after it was issued.

title: President Donald Trump pardons around 1,500 Jan. 6 attack defendants
shortDescription: On his first day back in office, President Donald Trump pardoned about 1,500 people charged in the Jan. 6, 2021 attack at the U.S. Capitol.

title: Bishop tells Trump to 'have mercy' on migrants, transgender children
shortDescription: "Have mercy upon the people in our country who are scared now," Bishop Mariann Edgar Budde urged President Trump at an inauguration prayer service.

title: White House removes webpage on Constitution, former presidents
shortDescription:
Donald Trump's team made quick work of taking down web pages about the founding documents 
 and information about former U.S. presidents.

title: Trump revokes security clearances of 51 former intelligence officials
shortDescription: Trump took the action after the former officials said in 2020 that leaks from Hunter Biden laptop could be "a Russian information operation."

title: Bishop pleads with Trump for marginalized people
shortDescription: At the traditional Service of Prayer for the Nation, a bishop used her moment in front of the president to plead for marginalized communities.

title: What we know about Trump's immigration orders
shortDescription: President Donald Trump signed a flurry of executive orders aimed at immigration on his first day in office. Here's what we know about them.

title: 'I got to use it': A look at Trump's evolution from TikTok foe to fan
shortDescription: Donald Trump is now being hailed as TikTok's savior after he tried to ban the app during his White House first term.

title: Trump uses exec order to halt wind energy. What to know
shortDescription: Trump temporarily halts offshore wind energy leases and pauses approvals, permits and loans for both offshore and onshore wind.

title: Trump issued a flurry of executive orders: See a list of highlights
shortDescription: Donald's Trump first day in office on Monday was marked by a huge list of executive orders. See some of the most talked about highlights.

title: 18 states sue Trump over order restricting birthright citizenship
shortDescription: After the Civil War, the Constitution was amended to consider every baby born in the US an American. Soon that may change.

title: President Trump attends National Prayer Service
shortDescription: President Donald Trump and Vice President JD Vance attend the National Prayer Service at Washington National Cathedral on Jan. 21, 2025.

title: Judge continues to block report on Trump's classified documents case
shortDescription: A federal judge blocked the release of Jack Smith's report on Donald Trump's classified documents case because his co-defendants face a possible trial

title: Biden continues presidential tradition with letter to Trump
